message_1: A student wants to choose two different colors out of six different colored marbles. How many different color combinations can the student choose?
message_2:
To find the number of different color combinations the student can choose, we can use the combination formula: C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!), where n is the total number of items and k is the number of items to choose.

In this case, n = 6 (total number of different colored marbles) and k = 2 (the student wants to choose two different colors).

C(6, 2) = 6! / (2!(6-2)!)

C(6, 2) = 6! / (2!4!)

C(6, 2) = (6 × 5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((2 × 1)(4 × 3 × 2 × 1))

C(6, 2) = (720) / (2 × 24)

C(6, 2) = 720 / 48

C(6, 2) = 15

So, the student can choose 15 different color combinations out of six different colored marbles.
